pros: Fantastic culture, benefits, and coworkers all set in a beautiful campus!

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Lincoln, NE
pros: Great place to work part time and invest in your professional development while also maintaining a family at home. Helpful coworkers, ample opportunity to learn a wide variety of skills and increase your leadership. Patients and their families are very rewarding to work with.
cons: Rehab patients can be difficult to take care of due to their many physical needs. Floor staff need to learn to care of themselves, take breaks, and be self advocates as we do in many other nursing environments.

job_title: Director of Finance in Lincoln, NE
pros: Many long term employees who genuinely share a passion for the mission of the organization. I always felt proud of the work Madonna did and felt a sense of purpose even though I wasn't in there patient care area.
cons: As a non-profit healthcare provider, Madonna faces difficult financial challenges and isn't always able to maintain competitive salaries. The work can be challenging, especially in the wake of the pandemic, and there are probably less stressful jobs where the financial reward would be greater.

pros: Fantastic coworkers and outstanding reputation for excellence in health care.

pros: Coworkers, flexible schedule,  great pay

review_title: Madonna is a great work in progress.
pros: They do make a great effort to provide for continuing education and to assist the therapists in reaching their goals.  They encourage personal growth in specialized training.  In the therapy field there is opportunity to move from unit to unit as openings are available.  They also allow cross training as time in the schedule allows.  This can be very important  as Madonna offers a wide range of specialized services including stroke, spinal cord injury, TBI and pediatrics as well as burns.  There are also different levels of therapy offered from longer term rehabilitation to acute rehab as well as SNF services.  The therapy staff is overall willing to help each other with learning new treatment ideas and problem solving through difficult situations.  They are also supportive of each other in general.  There is a  team approach when working with the patients and the patient is the priority.
cons: It can be a very fast paced environment with many things to know and stay on top of.  This may also be an upside to some people.  It can be frustrating when the work environment or procedures are constantly changing however,  I do also believe that these changes are being made with the best interests of the entire hospital in mind.

pros: Awesome nurses & team atmosphere!
cons: Staffing isn't the best sometimes.

pros: Being able to experience and contribute to a dedicated team that has nothing but a patient's goals in focus. Fairly easy to move up. More than fair pay. Great management (except for staffing).
cons: Hard to contact managers. Sometimes hires questionable talent. If you are PRN, don't consider working here, no pay increases or paid time off for PRN. Staffing makes it very difficult to get any time off. Then they call you ask expect you to help them when they are short. No thanks!

pros: The only pro is when I worked there I had an AMAZING team of co-workers but they all quit. None of the original staff is there anymore because they're abused.
cons: Unreasonable expectations, back-breaking work, management who would rather be in the office than on the floor helping you, unsafe staffing ratios. I worked here from the time it opened for over a year, I had to quit because the management will take advantage of you! The staffing ratios are extremely unsafe, I got hurt on the job and they still wanted me working doing patient care! They won't protect you from abusive patients, and they won't make sure you're taken care of! DO NOT WORK HERE!

pros: Plenty of available hours & benefits are acceptable.
cons: Company does not believe in seniority or promoting people based on experience or length of time at the company. They hire people who have had performance issues at previous companies or have performed poorly while working as a traveling employee. They fire older employees & discourage  teamwork & initiate backstabbing among workers.

pros: Your coworkers are probably the best ones you will ever meet. They say you can judge a work place by how much laughter there is, and you can always look forward to a good laugh with a friend or patient there. For the most part, the managers are very easy to approach with concerns and questions and it’s very easy to just have a quick conversation with them in their office. Some of the managers even send out cards to the employees whenever a patient or staff member compliments them for a job well-done.
cons: The pay is not competitive with the other hospitals or even nursing homes in the area. Other hospitals in our area paid a few dollars more for CNAs with less experience (or no experience) and had multiple (3 or more) cost of living raises while Madonna had one in three years and a lot of excuses for why we were all not getting our full annual raise. Because of this, I feel like Madonna hasn’t had many applicants for CNAs or they have quit during or shortly after orientation. We lost way to many good nurses and aides with years and years of experience to surrounding hospitals in the last few years. I feel like because of not being able to hire too many new Staff and not being able to retain old staff due to pay, the staffing for nurses and aides is not consistent. Some days for day shift there will be three CNAs to a side (18 patients give or take), the next day there may be only one CNA to the side with no change in patient population.

pros: Madonna is a very prestigious place to be employed. They really do improve peoples lives. Very many opportunities are available through this company.
cons: Sometimes the staffing department is not very flexible. To get certain days off you need to request days off and then find someone that will trade shifts with you.

pros: Overall a great place to work. They use a self scheduling program, so flexibility is an option. Staffing is wonderful to work with. Options for diverse work are there.  Management is fair and lets you do your job easily. Pay is competitive with other nursing jobs in the area. My co workers are the best!
cons: I can't think of any

review_title: Watch for sexism, discrimination and retaliation
pros: Lots of down time which is paid
cons: Suffer a work injury, have their Doctor lead your care, report a complete HIPAA violation to HR when given a chance to test your current abilities and lose your job...by mailed letter. Be told numerous times that men are weak and that all males are “whimps”. Hear constant swearing and about therapist drinking habits on a daily basis. HR treats you work-injured workers as a neusance. Retaliation and sexism (even towards a male) is illegal!
